item.description: On November 16th, The New York Time's Daily Podcast released an episode about Biden's Electric Car Problem, and I have a problem with it! Namely, it did not discuss public transit or other green transportation solutions.

item.title: Accessible Design - Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 12
item.description: Adding accessibility features to your website is a morally great thing to do! Unfortunately, many development teams often overlook these features. Here are some tips to get your started improving your accessibility today!

item.title: AI is Going to Change Education, in Fact it Already has
item.description: In less than six months ChatGPT has taken the world by storm. All industries are adapting to the new technology, education included. Initially there was a lot of hesitation and fear, but as educators begin to adopt the new technology in their classrooms it has become clear the fear may not be needed. AI will change education, but I think it will be for the better.
item.author: Andrew Nolan

item.title: Designing for Mobile, Not as Scary as it Sounds - Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 10
item.description: Designing a website for mobile used to be very scary. But really, the design principles are no different than anywhere else. Don't be scared modern frameworks make this easy.
item.author: Andrew Nolan

item.title: Musings on the Adoption of ChatGPT in K-12 Education Survey
item.description: The Walton Family Foundation's survey of K-12 Educators revealed a dramatic (over 50%) adoption of the tool in classrooms within a few months. What does this mean for education? I think it will help.
item.author: Andrew Nolan

item.title: Usability Testing on 18 Cents a Day - Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 9
item.description: Usability testing is the single most important thing you can do to improve your website's design. It does not have to be scary, in fact it is easy and inexpensive to do!
item.author: Andrew Nolan

item.title: Don't get Trapped in Pointless UX Debates! Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 8
item.description: Most UX arguments are a waste of time There are important UX discussions to be had, but make sure you can avoid discussions that aren't going anywhere and direct them in a good solution.
item.author: Andrew Nolan

item.title: It All Starts with a Big Bang! Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 7
item.description: In this chapter, Krug argues that like the universe began in a few seconds with a big bang, a user's impression of a website is formed in a few seconds on the homepage as well. So make sure your homepage is designed well!
item.author: Andrew Nolan

item.title: Navigating the web! Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 6
item.description: On the internet we magically teleport from page to page. Making sure the navigation on your website is strong is the best way to handle this magical journey.

item.title: Don't Make me Click?! Book Club: Don't Make me Think - Chapter 4
item.description: Today we take a look at Chapter 4 of Don't Make me Think, Krug's Second Law of Usability, "it doesn't matter how many times I have to click, as long as each click is a mindless, unambiguous choice."
